description.narrative: The proposed investment will have significant development impacts as follows: (a) Maintain the availability of trade finance for trade businesses in Mauritania. The Project is expected to finance in excess of US$1.5 billion of energy commodity trade flows to Mauritania over two years by providing much needed liquidity. This will protect an IDA economy against the risk of energy shortages, the risk of being cut off from suppliers as commercial banks have reduced their emerging market exposure. (b) Ensuring availability of energy products in the local economy, critical for consumption, power and other energy needs. A steady supply of critically needed fuel through regular channels will keep prices in check, remove parallel market incentives, and improve affordability particularly for the vulnerable poor and is necessary to sustain economic activities. (c) SME Development - By supporting the private sector companies in the country''s downstream oil sector, the project will provide business opportunities to local private companies involved in transportation, distribution, and retail of refined oil products

The proposed project consists of a revolving secured short term trade facility, with a significant funding mobilization factor, to support key private sector operators (the international energy trader and domestic oil marketing companies) in their access to finance the import, purchase and marketing of refined fuel products in Mauritania. The proposed project would lend in parallel along with Societe Generale, DFIs and other commercial lenders to BB Energy- the successful bidder under Government of Mauritanias oil import tender arrangement. BB Energy, an international trading company domiciled in the United Arab Emirates, has been awarded a 2-year contract to supply refined oil products to Mauritania for 2012-2014. The funding will be used by BB Energy to finance: (i) purchase of oil products imported into Mauritania and related storage expenses; (ii) as well as related receivables against local oil product marketing companies, and major domestic industrial entities which are consumers of refined fuel products.
